SEARCH
Module io.jstach.ezkv.kvs
Package io.jstach.ezkv.kvs

Interface KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesProvider

All Superinterfaces:
KeyValuesServiceProvider
Enclosing interface:
KeyValuesServiceProvider
public static non-sealed interface KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesProvider extends KeyValuesServiceProvider
This service provider is for other modules in your application to provide a reference configuration to be overriden and can be loaded using the "provider" URI scheme. This is akin to Lightbend/Typesafe Config reference.conf but without a resource call for maximum portability with things like GraalVM native, Maven shade plugin, and modular applications where the config could be an enscapulated resource (properties file) which would require the module to do the loading and not EZKV.

If one would like to load configuration from say properties file the implementation will have to do that on its own but is free to use the out of box KeyValuesMedia to parse things like properties files.

If using a Java modules it is recommended that the lower modules that are contributing config use requires static to the EZKV module to avoid unnecessary coupling if all they are doing is just providing reference config.

NOTE: It is recommend to avoid making key values that need interpolation from external variables as the variables may not be present. However interpolation based on the local keys being added is fine and encouraged (for example constructing a JDBC URL from a default port that is also provided). The idea again is that this reference config that needs to be guaranteed to be there for defaults and possibly participate in downstream variable/interpolation usage. It is highly recommended that you do not initialize other parts of the module that would initialize logging or something that needs configuration! If you need to use logging use the EZKV logging: KeyValuesEnvironment.getLogger() which will by default not initialize a logging framework. Example 

public class DatabaseConfigProvider implements KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesProvider {

	public void provide(KeyValues.Builder builder, LoaderContext context) {
		builder.add("database.host", "localhost");
		builder.add("database.port", "5245");
		builder.add("database.schema", "mydb");
		builder.add("database.url", "jdbc:postgresql://${database.host}/${database.port}/${database.schema}");
	}

}
Down stream database.port could be overriden.

Another common usage is some module has an Enum of configuration options. This extension point allows you to fill configuration programmatically so you can loop through the enum instances and add the default properties. 

public class ContextPathProvider implements KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesProvider {
	public enum ContextPath { // for example purposes this an inner class
		ACCOUNT("/account"), PROFILE("/profile");

		final String path;

		ContextPath(String path) {
			this.path = path;
		}
	}

	public void provide(KeyValues.Builder builder, LoaderContext context) {
		for (ContextPath p : ContextPath.values()) {
			builder.add("contextpath." + p.name().toLowerCase(), p.path);
		}
	}
}
Note that providers can make KeyValuesResource.KEY_LOAD keys to load other resources if they really would like to have resources loaded.

    Methods inherited from interface io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesServiceProvider

    order

  • Method Details

    • provide

      void provide(KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesProvider.ProviderContext context, KeyValues.Builder builder)
      Implementations should use the mutable builder to add key values. The provided builder will already be preconfigured based on the name() and other resource meta data.

      It is highly recommended that you do not initialize to many things in this call that would initialize logging or something that needs configuration!

      If you need to use logging use the EZKV logging: KeyValuesEnvironment.getLogger() which will by default not initialize a logging framework.

      Parameters:
      context - current load context should be used mainly to use KeyValuesEnvironment.getLogger() and to help parse literal strings that are properties.
      builder - used to add key values.

    • name

      default String name()
      The name used to identify where the key values are coming from. The name should follow "[a-zA-Z0-9]+" regex and because by default the Class.getSimpleName() is used this method should be implemented if your class does not follow that naming regex.
      Returns:
      by default Class.getSimpleName().
